questions.question: What is the SO2 uptake capacity of Zr-bptc at 0.1 bar and 298 K?
Which Zr-MOF shows the highest SO2 uptake at 273 K and 1.0 bar?
How does the introduction of amine groups affect the SO2 uptake in UiO-66 compared to its unmodified form?
questions.answer: It enhances the SO2 uptake by 76% at 0.1 bar and 298 K.

questions.question: True or False: The presence of atomically-dispersed CuII sites in UiO-66-CuII reduces its CO2 uptake at 0.15 bar and 298 K.
What is the role of in situ X-ray diffraction, infrared micro-spectroscopy, and inelastic neutron scattering in the study of Zr-MOFs for SO2 adsorption?
questions.answer: They enable the visualization of the binding domains of adsorbed SO2 molecules and host–guest binding dynamics at the atomic level.

questions.question: Which Zr-MOF has the highest IAST selectivity for SO2/CO2 at 298 K?
What is the significance of the BET surface area in the context of MOFs' SO2 adsorption capabilities?
questions.answer: The BET surface area is indicative of the pore volume and surface area available for gas adsorption, influencing the total uptake capacity.

questions.question: True or False: Zr-DMTDC shows a higher SO2 uptake at 0.1 bar and 298 K compared to UiO-66 due to its higher surface area.
What is the outcome of the dynamic breakthrough experiments with a mixture of SO2/CO2 in Zr-bptc?
questions.answer: Zr-bptc shows highly selective retention of SO2 with retention times of 213 and 235 min g-1 for mixtures of SO2/CO2 and SO2/N2, respectively.

questions.question: True or False: The captured SO2 in Zr-bptc can be converted quantitatively to aryl N-aminosulfonamide.
How does the presence of thienothiophene groups in Zr-DMTDC affect its SO2 adsorption compared to UiO-66?
questions.answer: It results in a 47% enhancement of SO2 uptake at 0.1 bar and 298 K.

questions.question: True or False: The SO2 adsorption capacity of a Zr-MOF is solely determined by its BET surface area.
What is the effect of introducing heteroatomic sulphur sites into the pores of Zr-MOFs on SO2 capture?
questions.answer: It enhances the capture of SO2 at low concentrations by providing additional binding sites.

questions.question: True or False: All seven Zr-MOFs studied show fully reversible uptakes of SO2 at 298 K and 1 bar.
What is the role of in situ synchrotron X-ray powder diffraction in the study of SO2 adsorption in Zr-MOFs?
questions.answer: It helps in the refinement of the pore environment and understanding the structural stability of Zr-MOFs during SO2 adsorption.

questions.question: True or False: The isosteric heats of adsorption (Qst) for SO2 are higher in UiO-66-NH2, UiO-66-CuII, and Zr-DMTDC compared to UiO-66.
What is the impact of functional group decoration on the SO2 adsorption performance of UiO-66 materials?
questions.answer: Decoration with functional groups or open CuII sites enhances the SO2 adsorption performance by providing additional binding sites and increasing the binding strength with SO2 molecules.

questions.question: True or False: The captured SO2 in Zr-bptc can be used directly without any conversion process for pharmaceutical applications.
What is the significance of the breakthrough experiments in the context of SO2 capture from gas mixtures?
questions.answer: Breakthrough experiments demonstrate the selective capture and retention time of SO2 from gas mixtures, validating the MOFs' potential for practical applications in gas separation and purification.

questions.question: True or False: The study confirms that Zr-MOFs with larger pores tend to have lower values of Qst due to reduced strength of host–guest interactions.
